CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 2;No violation of Art. 3;Violation of Art. 13;Not necessary to examine Art. 14;Pecuniary damage - financial award;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award;Costs and expenses partial award - Convention proceedings
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant , a NORP citizen of NORP origin , was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . The facts surrounding the killing of the applicant ’s brother , PERSON , are disputed by the parties .

CARDINAL . The facts as presented by the applicant are set out in Section B below ( see paragraphs CARDINAL ) . The Government ’s submissions concerning the facts are summarised in Section C below ( see paragraphs CARDINAL ) . GPE evidence submitted by the Government is summarised in Part D ( see paragraphs CARDINAL - CARDINAL below ) .

CARDINAL . NORP On DATE , the applicant ’s brother , PERSON , gave a statement to the Prosecutor at ORG ( hereinafter “ the ORG ” ) . He stated that he had heard that a certain Ms Amber Yılmaz had fallen from the roof of a QUANTITY - storey house in the course of a military operation conducted at TIME on DATE . He had further heard that ORG husband , PERSON , had been a ORG member and that Mr GPE was currently serving a DATE prison sentence for ORG membership . He finally stated that he was not aware of any links between ORG and the ORG ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) .

CARDINAL . After having given this statement , PERSON was followed on a number of occasions . In DATE PERSON , the wife of PERSON , was visited by CARDINAL policemen who asked her questions about her husband ’s whereabouts .

CARDINAL . At TIME on DATE , PERSON went to ORG in the centre of ORG . TIME after his arrival , a white ORG car with CARDINAL plain - clothes policemen stopped in front of the café . It is common knowledge in south - east GPE that this kind of car is used by plain - clothes police officers . CARDINAL policemen stayed in the car while the other QUANTITY entered the café . The latter CARDINAL policemen were the same as the ones who had previously questioned PERSON about her husband ’s whereabouts . It was obvious that the QUANTITY persons were policemen , as they were armed . Only members of the security forces could have entered a café in GPE carrying firearms . When the applicant ’s brother was leaving the café , the CARDINAL policemen also left the café . Outside the café the QUANTITY policemen took PERSON by the arms and forced him into the waiting white ORG . This was seen by all the persons present in the café . The car left in the direction of ORG . CARDINAL persons , who were present in the café when the plain - clothes police officers took PERSON away , told the applicant at a later stage about this incident and added that the persons who had abducted his brother were certainly police officers .

CARDINAL . On DATE , the applicant went to ORG of ORG in order to inform them of the incident . He was advised to file a petition with the office of the Prosecutor at ORG . The applicant then went to ORG to file a petition . However , the police at the door of the ORG building told him that his brother ’s name was not on their list . The applicant returned to ORG several times in the course of DATE and unsuccessfully tried to obtain information about his brother .

CARDINAL . At TIME on DATE , QUANTITY police officers came to the applicant ’s home and told him that his brother had been wounded and admitted to the hospital . When the police officers took the applicant to their car , they told him that his brother ’s body had been found outside the LOC cemetery in GPE . The applicant went with the police officers to the place where his brother ’s body had been found . There , the police searched him . They took his petition which was addressed to the Prosecutor at ORG from the pocket of his jacket . Despite his request , the police officers refused to give it back to him . The applicant is of the opinion that the police refused to return his petition in order to weaken any case he might bring against the NORP authorities .

CARDINAL . The body of the applicant ’s brother was lying on top of a rubbish heap near the ORG cemetery . PERSON of torture could be seen all over his body . It looked as if the skin on the soles of his feet had been pulled off with pincers . His arms , legs and head looked as if they had been skewered on a thick skewer . His whole body was black and blue and there were marks on his throat .

CARDINAL . After the police had shown the applicant the body of his brother , they took him in their car to his brother ’s house , where the police conducted a house search . During this search , the applicant heard on the police radio that the Prosecutor was about to go and see the body of his brother . The police interrupted their search in order to join the Prosecutor . They took the applicant with them . The Prosecutor did not put any questions to the applicant . The police recorded the location of the body and subsequently took the body to ORG morgue . The applicant was also taken to the morgue in a police car . On the way to the morgue , a police officer in the car told the applicant that all the villagers of GPE would die on the streets in the same manner .

CARDINAL . In the morgue , some other police officers told the applicant that village guards had burned the village of GPE and that these same village guards had probably killed his brother . The applicant replied that he did not believe that village guards had killed his brother and added that , if village guards had killed his brother , they must have been helped by the police . The police officers replied that PERSON , the daughter of the applicant ’s deceased brother , was of the opinion that the police had killed her father . When the applicant was asked whether he shared PERSON ’s opinion , he said that he did .

CARDINAL . In the morgue , an autopsy of the body of the applicant ’s brother was conducted . The applicant asked the doctor about the marks around his brother ’s throat . The doctor told him that something must have been passed around his brother ’s neck after his death and that his body must have been dragged along by it . After the autopsy , the body was released for burial .

CARDINAL . While the applicant was at the morgue , another group of police officers had returned to the house of the applicant ’s brother in order to finish the house search . These policemen told PERSON that her father had told the police that he had a package , which was likely to contain a firearm , and they asked her to give this package to them . According to the applicant , this question indicated that the security forces had in fact apprehended his brother and that they had interrogated , tortured and killed him . On DATE , a statement was taken from the applicant at FAC ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) .

CARDINAL . Some time before the events at issue , the applicant ’s oldest son PERSON had joined the ORG . The applicant had managed to keep this a secret . However , DATE after the death of his brother , a person , who introduced himself as GPE from the anti - terrorism branch of the police , came to the applicant ’s home . PERSON told the applicant that his son had joined the ORG and asked the applicant to inform the security forces when his son came home . The applicant thus became convinced that his brother must have told the security forces about PERSON while he was under torture .

CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the applicant was himself abducted by ORG agents while walking in the street in GPE . He was put in a car and prevented from seeing and speaking . He was taken into the countryside where ORG agents wanted to shoot him but they then changed their minds and took the applicant to the rapid response force building in GPE where he was detained for a period of DATE before being jailed for DATE . While in detention he was threatened a number of times . The content of the threats was , “ Do not follow your son ’s or your brother ’s way . If you do , we will kill you too ” . These threats made the applicant all the more convinced that the Government were directly responsible for the abduction and killing of his brother .

CARDINAL . At TIME on DATE , ORG was informed by passers - by that a person was lying near the GPE cemetery in GPE . Acting on that information , police officers found a body , with its hands tied behind its back . It was lying on top of a rubbish heap near the cemetery . The police found an identity card on the body in the name of PERSON .

CARDINAL . After being informed by the police , the Prosecutor in charge , Mr PERSON , and PERSON arrived at the scene . PERSON were found which could not be analysed as they were indistinguishable . There were no traces of any fight . Wheel traces were examined but were found to have been made after the discovery of the body . After an incident report had been compiled and a sketch map had been drawn up showing the location of the body , the corpse was taken to the morgue .

CARDINAL . On the basis of the identity card found on the body , the victim ’s family was contacted . The victim ’s brother , PERSON , was brought to the morgue where he identified the body as that of his brother PERSON . Subsequently an autopsy was carried out .

CARDINAL . According to their statements taken on DATE , the applicant and the victim ’s wife , PERSON , did not know who might have killed PERSON . They stated that they had no enemies at all . The applicant further declared that , in so far as he knew , his brother had been detained for firearms trafficking after the coup d’Etat of CARDINAL DATE . The victim ’s widow also stated that she wished to file a complaint against the person or persons who had killed her husband . Her criminal complaint was formally registered on DATE .

CARDINAL . The Prosecutor opened an investigation under file no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , which is currently still pending . The ORG has requested the police authorities to keep him informed on a regular basis about this investigation .
CARDINAL . The following information appears from the documents submitted by the Government .

CARDINAL . On DATE a statement was taken from PERSON , the applicant ’s brother , by the Prosecutor at FAC . Mr PERSON stated that he had heard that a female by the name of PERSON had fallen from the top of a QUANTITY building during a military operation which had taken place at TIME DATE . He further stated that he had heard that ORG ’s husband was serving a CARDINAL-year prison sentence because of his ORG membership . As far as he knew , PERSON was not a ORG member .

CARDINAL . At TIME on DATE , a deputy police chief and a police officer drew up an on - site report . According to this report , a number of persons had informed the police at TIME that they had seen a person lying on the side of the road , near the GPE cemetery . When the police arrived at the scene , they found the frozen body of a male , lying on its right side between the road and the wall of the cemetery . It was lying at an approximate distance of QUANTITY from the entrance to the cemetery . Its hands had been tied at the back with the belt of the coat the deceased was wearing . According to the identity card found on the body , the deceased was PERSON . No evidence was found at the scene .
CARDINAL . It was recorded in a sketch , drawn up by a police officer at TIME DATE to show the location of the body , that the cause of death was strangulation .

CARDINAL . According to another on - site report drawn up DATE , the duty Prosecutor and a pathologist attended to the body of the person , “ who had been strangled by a length of wire ” . They observed a large number of footprints near the body . However , casts of these footprints were not made because there were too many of them and also because they were all mixed up . Similarly , no casts of the tyre marks observed near the body were made because it was concluded that these marks had been made by vehicles “ which had nothing to do with the incident ” . There was no sign of a struggle at the scene and there was also no evidence capable of providing clues about the perpetrator(s ) of the killing . It was also noted in this report that the body had already been photographed by the police . The Prosecutor ordered the transfer of the body to the morgue at FAC for an autopsy .

CARDINAL . According to the autopsy report , the body was taken to the hospital at TIME . The applicant was already at the hospital when his brother ’s body arrived . He identified his brother and stated that he had been missing for DATE , during which time the family had been unsuccessfully searching for him . He added that he did not know who might have killed his brother .

CARDINAL . It was observed by the Prosecutor that rigor mortis had already set in . Also , a very large number of injuries and ecchymoses were observed on the face and on the trunk of the body . The doctor concluded that some of these injuries had been caused DATE previously and some of them DATE previously .

CARDINAL . According to a full autopsy carried out by the doctor , the cause of death was established as mechanical asphyxiation and it was concluded that the killing had been intentional . Taking into account the fact that rigor mortis had already set in , the doctor concluded that the death had occurred TIME . At the end of the autopsy , the body was photographed once more . The Prosecutor issued a burial licence and instructed the police officers to carry out a comprehensive investigation .

CARDINAL . Also on DATE , at TIME , a statement was taken from the applicant by the police chief at the NORP police station . The applicant stated that his brother had not returned to his house in TIME of DATE . The following day he had gone to the café which his brother used to frequent and asked the people there whether they had seen him . He was told by the people there that QUANTITY persons had come into the café DATE and gone straight up to PERSON who had been sitting in the café . The CARDINAL men and PERSON had then left the café together and got into a white ORG estate car and driven away . The number plate of the car had not been “ obvious ” . The applicant stated that he did not know to what extent this sequence of events , which had been relayed to him by the people in the café , represented the truth . He also stated that he had tried to submit a petition to the Prosecutor at ORG but that it was not accepted . He added that he did not suspect anyone in particular and that the family did not have any enemies . He finally stated that his brother had served a prison sentence after DATE for an arms dealing offence .

CARDINAL . On DATE , the police chief at the GPE police station took a statement from PERSON , the widow of the applicant ’s deceased brother PERSON . Mrs NORP stated that her husband had left their family home at around CARDINAL a.m. on DATE . When he had failed to return home in the evening , she had informed her brother - in - law , the applicant , and asked him to make the necessary enquiries in order to find her husband . Despite all their efforts , they had not been able to find her husband . She did not suspect anyone in particular and the family did not have any enemies . She had been told by the applicant that her husband had been taken away from the café in a white ORG car . She asked the Prosecutor to prosecute the persons who killed her husband .

CARDINAL . Finally , on DATE the police chief of the NORP police station forwarded to ORG his report in which he informed the latter about the body found in his area . He also appended to his report the CARDINAL statements ( see paragraph CARDINAL - CARDINAL above ) , the on - site reports and the sketch prepared TIME ( see paragraphs CARDINAL above ) .

CARDINAL . It appears that this report and its appendices were transferred to the ORG ’s office in ORG who opened an investigation into the killing DATE . The investigation was given the number CARDINAL/CARDINAL .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Prosecutor instructed ORG to search for the perpetrator(s ) of the killing .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG repeated his instructions to ORG and asked to be kept informed DATE of any possible developments until the expiry of the statutory limitation period on DATE . The Prosecutor repeated his instructions to ORG on DATE , CARDINAL DATE and DATE .
